name: 現代與當代英文詩選
comment: 上課教室在雲和街大樓二樓，地址為雲和街1號(位於雲和小火鍋斜對面、Cafe a la mode正對面)，從師大側門右轉看見Starbucks右轉進入巷子步行約2分鐘(130公尺)，右手邊就會看到雲和街大樓，亦可使用Google Maps APP查詢位置。請同學使用學生證感應，進出雲和街上課教室。
description:
The purpose of the course is to introduce graduate students to some of the most important recent poetry in English. The focus this semester is mainly on poetry that was produced after World War Two, though the course begins with an introduction to important developments from earlier in the twentieth century. Poets from England, Wales, Scotland, (Northern) Ireland, Australia, America, Canada, Saint Lucia, and West Germany are featured on the course. 

Themes include:
	Developments in idiom and form 
	Traditions and counter-reactions 
	“Mainstream” vs. “innovative” poetries (in this version of the course there will be more emphasis on the former)
	Cosmopolitanism
	Cultural authority and post-imperial conditions
	Satire and political critique
	New secular myths
	Ecological poetry and new pastorals
	The public and private functions of the poet (and what lies in between, including collaboration)
	Sexualities
	Poetics and mental health
goals: introduce graduate students to some of the most important recent poetry by British, Irish and American writers
provides students with some exceptionally helpful coordinates for their dealings with the poetry that came afterwards
syllabus:
SCHEDULE  

Week 1

Minor and great: W.B. Yeats, A.E. Housman, Thomas Hardy, Edward Thomas, Robert Frost, Wilfred Owen

Week 2

After modernism: W.H. Auden, Dylan Thomas, Edwin Muir

Week 3

Movements: Philip Larkin, Elizabeth Jennings, D.J. Enright

Weeks 4-5

Units of excess: John Berryman, Robert Lowell

Week 6

Elizabeth Bishop

Week 7

New York and its environs: James Schuyler, John Ashbery, Frank O’Hara

Week 8

“In the refuse pit”: A.R. Ammons, W.S. Merwin

Week 9

Sylvia Plath

Weeks 10-11

Ted Hughes

Week 12

Excavating a home: Peter Redgrove, Penelope Shuttle

Week 13

Seamus Heaney

Week 14

Derek Walcott

Week 15

Les Murray

Week 16

Clarities: Louise Glück, Amy Clampitt, Anne Carson

Week 17

The future of poetry: Michael Hofmann, Karen Solie

Week 18

Consolidation

(Electronically send copy of essay by deadline)
